title: A Calligrapher's Journey: Society of Scribes lecture in NYC
content:
**A Calligrapher's Journey  
A Lecture presented by The Society of Scribes**

**Tuesday, October 16th, 2007  
6:00 pm  
Donnell Library Center (NYPL)  
20 West 53rd Street, 2nd Floor  
New York, NY 10019-6185**

Bob Boyajian, a prominent New York calligrapher for forty years, discusses his career in calligraphy. A sampling of his work can be seen at [www.bobboyajian.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053529/http:/bobboyajian.com/). The lecture is in conjuction with the Society of Scribes exhibit, on display at Donnell from September 5th to October 31st.

All New York Public Library programs are free of charge.

More info:

[The Society of Scribes](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053529/http:/www.societyofscribes.org/upcoming.htm#07members)  
 [New York Public Library: Donnell Library Center](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053529/http:/www.nypl.org/branch/central/dlc/)

(P.S. I submitted this item to General Discussions because I was not allowed to post in the News section.)
author: Ricardo Cordoba
